title: A Cellmate's Heartfelt Tribute to Stan Swamy:  "You Never Go Away" - A Year After His Passing
content:
This moving letter, written by Vernon, Stan Swamy's cellmate, is a testament to the enduring legacy of the late activist. Vernon recounts their time together in Taloja Central Jail, highlighting Stan's unwavering spirit and the injustice he faced. He emphasizes Stan's impact, arguing that his work and ideals cannot be silenced, despite the attempts to erase his voice. 

Vernon's words paint a poignant picture of Stan's character, describing his quiet strength and unwavering commitment to truth and justice. He underscores the cruelty of the fabricated charges against Stan, pointing to the manipulation and fabrication of evidence used to silence him. 

This deeply personal letter, written a year after Stan's passing, serves as a powerful reminder of his life and work. It highlights the importance of remembering Stan's legacy, fighting for justice, and continuing the fight for a more equitable society.
author: Vernon Gonsalves
